item.title: Natural disasters - and what we can learn from them
item.description: Natural disasters can occur all over the world. But even for countries that got off easy until now, looking abroad for help will only prove to be beneficial!
item.keywords: DWVC,natural disaster, catastrophe, help, rescue, preparation, climate change, climate crisis, civil protection, disaster control

media:content.media:title: Natural disasters - and what we can learn from them

item.title: Why does Germany want to legalize Cannabis?
item.description: The German government unveiled its plans to legalise cannabis in October 2022. German consumers would be able to buy up to 30 grammes of cannabis for private consumption with supplies cultivated and distributed through a controlled market. But questions remain about possible risks, like the protection of minors.
item.keywords: DWVC,cannabis, legalization, weed, Germany, legalisation, drug

media:content.media:title: Why does Germany want to legalize Cannabis?
media:content.media:keywords: DWVC,cannabis, legalization, weed, Germany, legalisation, drug

item.description: She is known for her infectious smile and has the coolest job - meet the world's first Black female hot balloon pilot, aka Captain Smile!

item.title: Putin's war in Ukraine hits African nations
item.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has fueled a food crisis in many African nations. Experts say the African continent must supply its own sustenance. @DW
item.keywords: DWVC,Russia, Ukraine, war, Kenya, Africa, food, wheat, grain, crisis

item.title: Could your favorite cook be replaced by a robot?
item.description: This restaurant in Croacia has a robot that can prepare dishes from scratch and in a single pot. Will real cooks soon not be needed at all?

item.title: Quakes leave children traumatized and at risk
item.description: In the aftermath of the earthquakes in Turkey and Syria, the level of trauma suffered by survivors is enormous. Among the homeless are thousands of children. They are particularly vulnerable and urgently need help. Julia Hahn reports from Kahramanmaras.
item.keywords: DWVC,Earthquake, trauma, Turkey, Syria, mental health

media:content.media:title: Quakes leave children traumatized and at risk
media:content.media:keywords: DWVC,Earthquake, trauma, Turkey, Syria, mental health

item.title: The Russian invasion of Ukraine: A year in pictures
item.description: Ukraine was invaded by Russia on February 24, 2022. A look back at the first year of war through images, while there is still no end in sight.
item.keywords: DWVC,War anniversary, 1-year Russian war, Ukraine, Russia, Bucha, Mariupol, look back, photos

item.title: Trying to save refugees from the cold
item.description: Refugees died of hypothermia in recent years while attempting to reach European shores. NGO worker Davide Pittioni would like to provide a warm shelter for all arriving in the northern Italian city of Trieste, but theyâ€™re out of space.

item.title: Ukraine calls for Olympics ban on Russia and Belarus
item.description: "How can we stand next to our murderers on a podium?" Ukraine is on a mission to get Russian and Belarusian athletes banned from the 2024 Paris Olympics.

item.description: Dye-sensitised solar cells can now absorb light across the entire spectrum of visible light.
